cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles (280 km) south of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move north across the Yucatan Channel, strengthen over the Gulf of Mexico, make landfall along the Florida Panhandle, then curve northeast across the Southeast U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic coast and move offshore near the NC/VA area late Thursday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Cabo Catoche, Mexico (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Pinar del Río Province and Isle of Youth, Cuba (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Florida, then the U.S. Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday into Friday; occasional gusts possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Wilmington, DE given current forecast track well to the south
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late next week as remnant system passes offshore, which could cause brief run-off issues
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or tidal flooding and temporary restrictions on vessel movements possible if pressure gradient tightens ahead of the system
